examples.input: Simulate opinion dynamics with 100 agents on small_world network. Measure cluster stability (lifetime) with perception asymmetry alpha=0.1.
examples.output: Hypothesis: Higher perception asymmetry (alpha) leads to more stable opinion bubbles because agents discount outgroup signals, preventing cluster merging.
examples.method: Asymmetric Bounded-Confidence Agent-Based Model: Modulates confidence bounds based on perception asymmetry - agents perceive their ingroup as more diverse than outgroups, discounting outgroup signals ...
